summary: This document contains multiple alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Southern Financial LLC and its associated entities, highlighting various SEC violations related to insider trading and securities fraud. The alerts detail regulatory actions taken against these entities and individuals involved in fraudulent investment schemes, including contempt of court rulings and misappropriation of investor funds.

persons.name: Tracy Calvin Dunlap, Jr.
persons.context: Dunlap was adjudged in contempt of court for refusing to produce documents and account for investor funds related to fraudulent schemes.

persons.name: Richard M. Wooten
persons.context: Wooten is named as a defendant in multiple SEC actions against Southern Financial Group, Inc. for securities fraud.

persons.name: Charles Dennis McKittrick
persons.context: McKittrick is also named as a defendant in SEC actions related to Southern Financial Group, Inc. for fraudulent activities.

persons.name: James W. "Bill" Bailey, Jr.
persons.context: Bailey is mentioned in connection with a Ponzi scheme involving Southern Financial Services, Inc., defrauding investors.

connections.description: Dunlap is a defendant associated with Southern Financial Group, Inc. in multiple SEC actions.
Wooten is a defendant in SEC actions against Southern Financial Group, Inc. for securities fraud.
McKittrick is a defendant in SEC actions against Southern Financial Group, Inc. for fraudulent activities.
Bailey is the founder of Southern Financial Services, Inc. and is involved in a Ponzi scheme.

events.title: SEC Civil Charges Filed
events.description: The SEC filed civil charges against Southern Financial Services and others for securities fraud.

events.title: Court Contempt Ruling
events.description: The court found Southern Financial Group and Tracy Calvin Dunlap, Jr. in contempt for failing to produce documents.

events.title: SEC Allegations
events.description: The SEC alleged that Southern Financial Group misrepresented its financial position.

events.title: Contempt Ruling
events.description: The U.S. District Court found Dunlap and others in civil contempt for not obeying court orders.

events.title: Final Judgments Entered
events.description: Final judgments were entered against Southern Financial Group for fraudulent investment schemes.

keyFacts: Southern Financial Services, Inc. and its affiliates were involved in multiple SEC violations related to insider trading and securities fraud.
Tracy Calvin Dunlap, Jr. was found in contempt of court for failing to comply with orders regarding investor funds.
Richard M. Wooten and Charles Dennis McKittrick are repeatedly named as defendants in SEC actions against Southern Financial Group.
James W. "Bill" Bailey, Jr. was charged with running a Ponzi scheme through Southern Financial Services, Inc.
The document includes multiple alerts regarding regulatory actions against Southern Financial entities for fraudulent activities.
